Package model

Interface Manager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IOManager
    public interface Manager
    The model for this program. This interface contains methods that can add, remove, and retrieve Partys and Characters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addCharacter​(Character c)
      Adds the given Character to this Manager.
      void addParty​(java.lang.String name, Character... c)
      Adds a Party to this Manager with the given name.
      void damage​(java.lang.String name, int amount)
      Reduces the hp of the Character in the party that has the given name.
      boolean doesCharacterExist​(java.lang.String name)
      Determines whether this Manager contains a Character with the given name.
      boolean doesPartyExist​(java.lang.String name)
      Determines whether this Manager contains a Party with the given name.
      Character findCharByName​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the Character in this manage with the given name.
      Party findPartyByName​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the Party in this manage with the given name.
      Party getActiveParty()
      Returns the current active party that this Manager is using.
      Character[] getAllCharacters()
      Returns every Character this Manager has.
      Party[] getAllParties()
      Returns every Party this Manager has.
      java.lang.String[] getRoles()
      Returns a String array featuring every role that the Characters in this Manager has.
      java.lang.String[] getStats()
      Returns a String array featuring every stat that the Characters in this Manager has.
      boolean hasCharacters()
      Returns whether this Manager has any Characters in it.
      boolean hasParties()
      Returns whether this Manager has any Partys in it.
      boolean hasStartedACampaign()
      Returns whether a campaign has been started with this Manager.

      Adds to the hp value of a the Character in the party that has the given name.
      void removeCharacter​(java.lang.String name)
      Removes the Character from this Manager whose name matches the given String.
      void removeParty​(java.lang.String name)
      Removes the Party from this Manager whose name matches the given String.
      void setActiveParty​(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the party the manager is going to use.
      void startCampaign​(boolean start)
      Starts or ends a campaign with this Manager, using the active party.

      • hasStartedACampaign

        boolean hasStartedACampaign()
        Returns whether a campaign has been started with this Manager.
        Returns:
        true if a campaign has been started, otherwise false.

      • startCampaign

        void startCampaign​(boolean start)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts or ends a campaign with this Manager, using the active party.
        Parameters:
        start - flag to either start or end a campaign
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the active party is null.

             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the party the manager is going to use.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the party to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no parties OR if a campaign has been started
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given String is null OR there's no party with the given name

      • addCharacter

        void addCharacter​(Character c)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds the given Character to this Manager.
        Parameters:
        c - the character to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given character is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there's a character in this manager with the given name

      • addParty

        void addParty​(java.lang.String name,
              Character... c)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds a Party to this Manager with the given name. The Party is made up of the given Characters. If any of the given Characters are NOT in this Manager, they get added to this Manager.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to index the party as
        c - the characters to put into the party
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given String is null OR if the given String is whitespace OR if any of the characters are null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there's a party in this manager with the given name

      • removeCharacter

        void removeCharacter​(java.lang.String name)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Removes the Character from this Manager whose name matches the given String. This method should also go through every Party where the character being removed appears in, and remove them. This means editing all of those Parties.

        So for example, if a Party, p1, contains characters c1, c2, c3; and another Party, p2, contains c2, c3, c4, c5, c6; and lastly p3, contains just c2. If c2 is removed, p1 becomes c1, c3; p2 becomes c3, c4, c5, c6, and p3 is removed since a Party cannot contain 0 Characters.

        In the case that a party is removed via this method, and said party was the active party, this method should set the active party to the first party this Manager has. If there are no parties after this method removes a party, the active party should be set to null.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the character to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given String is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no characters

      • removeParty

        void removeParty​(java.lang.String name)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Removes the Party from this Manager whose name matches the given String. This method should NOT remove the Characters from the manager.

        If the party that was removed was the active party, this method should set the active party to the first party this Manager has. If there are no parties after this method removes a party, the active party should be set to null.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the party to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given String is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no parties
